content.webTitle: Rugby league: Saayman given year ban

fields.headline: Workington centre given year's ban for illegal betting
fields.bodyText: Workington's South African centre Weldon Saayman has been banned for a year by the Rugby Football League after being found guilty of betting on the outcome of matches, including at least one involving his own club. Saayman, a former Currie Cup rugby union player who helped Bedford to victory in last year's Powergen Vase at Twickenham, is understood to have placed the bets when he was out with a knee injury earlier this season. He is the first player to be banned for breaching the RFL's operational rules which forbid gambling on any professional matches since the case involving Sean Long and Martin Gleeson of St Helens in 2004.
